com.buralotech.oss.ldapunit

Annotation Type DirectoryServerConfiguration


  • @Target(value={TYPE,METHOD})
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface DirectoryServerConfiguration
    This annotation is used to specify the parameters used to configure the LDAP directory server. The annotation can be applied to the test class or method. If the annotation has been applied to both the test class and the test method the the annotation on the test method is used.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Brian Matthews

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Fields and Description
      static int DEFAULT_PORT
      The default TCP port for the directory server.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String authDN
      The DN that will be configured as the administrator account identifier.
      String authPassword
      The password that will be configured as the authentication credentials for the administrator account.
      String[] baseAttributes
      The attribute name/value pairs used for the base DN.
      String baseDN
      The DN that will be configured as the root of the LDAP directory.
      String[] baseObjectClasses
      The object classes used for the base DN.
      String[] ldifFiles
      The locations of optional LDIF files that can be used to see the LDAP directory with an initial data set.
      int port
      The TCP port that the LDAP directory server will be configured to listen on.
      String[] schemaFiles
      The location of the optional schema LDIF files that can be use to have a LDAP directory with a custom schema.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_PORT

        public static final int DEFAULT_PORT
        The default TCP port for the directory server.

    • Element Detail

      • port

        public abstract int port
        The TCP port that the LDAP directory server will be configured to listen on.
        Returns:
        The TCP port.
        Default:
        10389

      • baseDN

        public abstract String baseDN
        The DN that will be configured as the root of the LDAP directory.
        Returns:
        The DN.
        Default:
        "dc=buralotech,dc=com"

      • baseObjectClasses

        public abstract String[] baseObjectClasses
        The object classes used for the base DN.
        Returns:
        The object classes.
        Default:
        {"domain", "top"}

      • baseAttributes

        public abstract String[] baseAttributes
        The attribute name/value pairs used for the base DN.
        Returns:
        The attribute name/value pairs.
        Default:
        {}

      • authDN

        public abstract String authDN
        The DN that will be configured as the administrator account identifier.
        Returns:
        The DN.
        Default:
        "uid=admin,ou=system"

      • authPassword

        public abstract String authPassword
        The password that will be configured as the authentication credentials for the administrator account.
        Returns:
        The password.
        Default:
        "secret"

      • ldifFiles

        public abstract String[] ldifFiles
        The locations of optional LDIF files that can be used to see the LDAP directory with an initial data set. The files may localed on the file system or the classpath. The classpath is checked first and then falls back to che file system if it was not found on the class path.
        Returns:
        An array of LDIF file paths.
        Default:
        {}

      • schemaFiles

        public abstract String[] schemaFiles
        The location of the optional schema LDIF files that can be use to have a LDAP directory with a custom schema. The file may located on the file system or the classpath. The classpath is checked first and then falls back to the file system if it was no found on the class path.
        Returns:
        The file paths of the schemas in LDIF.
        Default:
        {}
